posts.name: Arnaud Girard
posts.cooked:
Hi my team is trying to use the new radios from the championship to communicate to our robot. The setup we are using is as follows : we have one radio on the robot which is set to robot radio mode with DIP switch 3 on and one radio next to our programming pc which is set to access point mode with all DIP switches off we are then connected to this radio with an eternet cable that goes into our computer.

However when we tried this the radio would crash when trying to deploy our code and if it worked it would disable occasionally for no reason leaving no error message in the rio log.

Please help.

You have it setup backwards. for the radio to operate in 6gz mode you want the radio off the robot to be set as a 6ghz access point and program the robot radio to connect to it.

image 965×247 41.3 KB

image 965×247 41.3 KB

image 965×247 41.3 KB

in your current setup you are operating in 2.4ghz mode which is far more prone to disconnects and interruptions

posts.name: Arnaud Girard
posts.cooked: I have tried this and it seems like it doesn’t work because when I tried it the status lights on the radio on the robot all started flashing together except the led that indicates if the radio is powered on. I have tested it with both the dip switch 3 on and off.

image 961×588 60.7 KB sounds like you still have some sort of configuration issue the above lists the error codes

image 961×588 60.7 KB

image 961×588 60.7 KB

posts.name: Ryan Blue
posts.cooked:
Arnaud_Girard:

when I tried it the status lights on the radio on the robot all started flashing together

As shown in the screenshot posted above, that indicates the radio is in AP mode while powered off a battery. You need to program the radio that is on the robot in Robot Radio mode. (which is what it sounded like you had done in your original post)

Arnaud_Girard:

However when we tried this the radio would crash when trying to deploy our code

What were the exact symptoms you experienced and any messages that were printed in the deploy log?

posts.name: Arnaud Girard
posts.cooked: I found the problem. I simply didn’t update the firmware of the radio since we got it between april-may. I feel quite dumb about that.
